meanings.definition: A small piece of parchment inscribed with specified Hebrew verses from the Torah, placed in a case affixed to the doorpost of a Jewish house as a sign of faith.
meanings.sent1: The mezuza on the doorpost reminded them of their faith every time they entered the house.
meanings.sent2: She carefully touched the mezuza as she walked through the doorway.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the mezuza, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The mezuza on the doorpost stood as a silent guardian of their home.
meanings.sent5: The golden mezuza gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: The case containing the parchment inscribed with Hebrew verses, affixed to the doorpost.
meanings.sent1: He gently touched the mezuza case before entering the house.
meanings.sent2: The intricate design of the mezuza case added elegance to the doorpost.
meanings.sent3: The mezuza case swung open unexpectedly, surprising the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her grandmother's antique mezuza case held sentimental value for the family.
meanings.sent5: The wooden mezuza case protected the sacred parchment inside.
